title: Implicitly unwrapped optionals
question: Which of these are true about optionals?
hint: Both String? and String! might have a value or might not.
correct: Optionals allow us to represent the absence of a value.
A String? must be unwrapped before use.
A String! does not need to be unwrapped before use.
Swift uses nil to represent the absence of a value.
You can use if let or guard let to unwrap optionals.
If you try to use an implicitly unwrapped optional when it is nil, your code crashes.
wrong: You shouldn't pass optionals into functions
You can't use both String! and String? in the same program.
Once an optional has a value, you can't set it back to nil.
